description: The hpnicfStackPortLinkStatusChange trap indicates that the link status
of the stack port has changed.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HPN-ICF-STACK-MIB::hpnicfStackPortLinkStatusChange HPN-ICF-STACK-MIB::hpnicfStackMemberID i 9999 HPN-ICF-STACK-MIB::hpnicfStackPortIndex i 9999 HPN-ICF-STACK-MIB::hpnicfStackPortStatus i 1

description: The member ID of the device in a stack.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-STACK-MIB::hpnicfStackMemberID

description: The index of a stack port of the device.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-STACK-MIB::hpnicfStackPortIndex

description: The link status of a stack port on the device.
up: A physical link is present on the stack port.
down: No physical link is present on the stack port.
silent: The link state of the stack port is up
but the port cannot transmit or receive traffic.
disabled: The stack port does not contain physical links.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-STACK-MIB::hpnicfStackPortStatus

description: The hpnicfStackTopologyChange trap indicates that the topology type of
the IRF stack has changed.

event.Summary: IRF stack topology type changed to $v1

description: Stack topology.
chainConn: daisy-chain connection
ringConn: ring connection
variables.name: HPN-ICF-STACK-MIB::hpnicfStackTopology

description: The hpnicfStackMadBfdChangeNormal trap indicates that the BFD MAD function
changed to the normal state.
A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: A textual string containing information about the
interface. This string should include the name of the
manufacturer, the product name and the version of the
interface hardware/software.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifDescr

description: The hpnicfStackMadBfdChangeFailure trap indicates that the BFD MAD function
changed to the failure state.
A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: A textual string containing information about the
interface. This string should include the name of the
manufacturer, the product name and the version of the
interface hardware/software.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifDescr

description: The hpnicfStackMadLacpChangeNormal trap indicates that the LACP MAD function
changed to the normal state.
A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.

description: A textual string containing information about the
interface. This string should include the name of the
manufacturer, the product name and the version of the
interface hardware/software.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifDescr

A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer

description: A textual string containing information about the
